page.title: 09Religion
page.content: The only existing place of worship in the village is the parish church of St Chad,although there is evidence of an earlier chapel on the site.The present building was erected around 1300.A tower was added in 1722,and the present windows are Victorian.One distinguishing feature inside the church is the Minstrels gallery. Although historically an independent parish for many centuries the village now shares an incumbent with nearby Preston and Tibberton.There are however regular Sunday services still held,with a Sunday school continuing weekly.The Parochial Church Council with its elected offices of churchwarden,Secretary and Treasurer still flourishes as part of the Diocese of Lichfield.There is a Parish Council of five who meet several times a year.
